greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = count of increasing runs in two concatenated k-permutations of [n].
example: Take the 2-permutations of [2] namely 12 and 21 and form all possible strings that are concatenations of two of these permutations. These are 1212,1221,2112,2121 with 2,3,3,3 increasing runs respectively. T(2,2) = 2+3+3+3 = 11.
xref: Column 1 = T(n, 1) = A005449, Second pentagonal numbers: n*(3n+1)/2.
results.author: _David Scambler_, Oct 29 2006
